0: Donald Trump Jr. liked two tweets on Tuesday that peddled a conspiracy theory about a 17-year-old survivor of the Parkland school shooting, suggesting that he was "coached" to propagate an anti-Trump narrative by his father who is a retired FBI agent. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Both tweets attacked David Hogg, one of the students who documented the horror felt by his peers during the Parkland school shooting, and who has since been outspoken in his call for lawmakers and politicians to take action against guns. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Hogg had referred to President Trump's tweet blaming the FBI for the shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School as "disgusting" and told CNN that his father was a retired FBI agent. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "The FBI are some of the hardest-working individuals I've ever seen in my life," Hogg said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In an interview with NBC, Hogg also urged Trump to take gun reform action, saying, "You're the president. You're supposed to bring this nation together, not divide us. How dare you? Children are dying, and their blood is on your hands because of that. Please take action. Stop going on vacation in Mar-a-Lago. Take action. Work with Congress.
